content: up either in the round or flat start with an inch or so of your preferred ribbing then switch to stockinette stitch create a small opening for the keychain base by binding off 2 sts and casting them back on the next round continue knitting and shape the crown with decreases or keep the hat body straight and cinch the top end later note that you can easily adjust the brim width or opt for a no-fold brim just ensure that the opening for the keychain base i e the round/row with 2 sts bound off is approximately 1 2 5cm from the folded edge for folded brim or cast-on edge for regular brim with no fold for more detailed instructions see below option a knit in the round fingering-weight yarn dk-weight yarn co 32 sts or a multiple of 2x for 1x1 ribbing/a co 28 sts or a multiple of 2x for 1x1 ribbing/a multiple of 4x for 2x2 ribbing join to knit in the multiple of 4x for 2x2 ribbing join to knit in round careful not to twist the sts place a the round careful not to twist the sts place a stitch marker at the beginning of round stitch marker at the beginning of round rounds 1-10 work ribbing pattern of choice rounds 1-7 work ribbing pattern of choice 1x1 ribbing k1 p1 repeat to end or 1x1 ribbing k1 p1 repeat to end or 2x2 ribbing k2 p2 repeat to end 32 sts 2x2 ribbing k2 p2 repeat to end 28 sts rounds 11-15 k all sts 32 sts rounds 8-11 k all sts 28 sts round 16 k15 bobble 2 sts k to end 30 sts round 12 k13 bobble 2 sts k to end 26 sts round 17 k to gap co 2 sts using round 13 k to gap co 2 sts using backwards loop cast on k to end 32 sts backwards loop cast on k to end 28 sts rounds 18 and 19 k all sts 32 sts rounds 14 and 15 k all sts 28 sts round 20 k2tog repeat to end 16 sts round 16 k2tog repeat to end 14 sts round 21 k all sts 16 sts round 17 k all sts 14 sts round 22 k2tog repeat to end 8 sts round 18 k2tog repeat to end 7 sts round 23 k all sts 8 sts round 24 k2tog repeat to end 4sts for both yarn weight cut the yarn leaving a long tail for sewing using a tapestry needle thread the yarn end through the remaining sts and pull them tight to close fold the cast-on edge up to create a double brim with the opening for the keychain base at about 1 2 5cm from the folded edge weave in ends attach a pom-pom if desired tips alternatively you can knit the hat body straight without any crown shaping bind off on the last round and then sew the top seams together see photos
